arguments.description: P

arguments.name: PBAR
arguments.description: PBAR

arguments.name: PPM
arguments.description: P'

arguments.name: P0
arguments.description: Po

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: RANGES
arguments.description: Estimates the process standard deviation for a boxplot using subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: READALPHA
arguments.description: Specifies that the variable _ALPHA_, rather than the variable _SIGMAS_, is to be read from a LIMITS= data set when both variables are available in the data set.

arguments.name: READINDEX=
arguments.description: Reads one or more sets of control limits from a LIMITS= data set (specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement) for each process listed in the chart statement.

arguments.name: READLIMITS
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits are to be read from a LIMITS= data set specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement.

arguments.name: READPHASES=
arguments.description: Selects blocks of consecutive observations to be read from the input data set.

arguments.name: REPEAT
arguments.description: Specifies that the horizontal axis of a chart that spans multiple panels be arranged so that the last subgroup position on a panel is repeated as the first subgroup position on the next panel.

arguments.name: RSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an R chart.

arguments.name: R
arguments.description: R

arguments.name: RBAR
arguments.description: RBAR

arguments.name: RPM
arguments.description: R'

arguments.name: R0
arguments.description: Ro

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: RTMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the right marginal area for the plot requested with the RTMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: RTMPLOT=
arguments.description: Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the right margin of the control chart.
arguments.help: RTMPLOT=DIGIDOT | HISTOGRAM | SKELETAL | SCHEMATIC | SCHEMATICID | SCHEMATICIDFAR

arguments.name: DIGIDOT
arguments.description: Digidot plot

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Histogram

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: Skeletal box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATICID
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled

arguments.name: SCHEMATICIDFAR
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

arguments.name: SEPARATE
arguments.description: Displays primary and secondary charts on separate screens or pages.

arguments.name: SERIFS
arguments.description: Adds serifs to the whiskers of skeletal box-and-whisker charts.

arguments.name: SIGMA0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value, σ0, for the process standard deviation, σ.

arguments.name: SIGMAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.name: SIMULATEQCFONT
arguments.description: Draws the central line labels using a simulated software font rather than a hardware font.

arguments.name: SKIPHLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number n of consecutive tick mark labels, beginning with the second tick mark label, that are thinned (not displayed) on the horizontal (subgroup) axis.

arguments.name: SMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.
arguments.help: SMETHOD=NOWEIGHT | MVLUE | RMSDF | MAD | MMR | MVGRANGE

arguments.name: NOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ.

arguments.name: MVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ

arguments.name: RMSDF
arguments.description: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ

arguments.name: MAD
arguments.description: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ (IRCHART only)

arguments.name: MMR
arguments.description: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ (IRCHART only)

arguments.name: MVGRANGE
arguments.description: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means (XRCHART and XSCHART only)

arguments.name: SPLIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a special character that is inserted into the label of a process variable or summary statistic variable and whose purpose is to split the label into two parts.

arguments.name: SSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an S chart.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: S

arguments.name: SBAR
arguments.description: SBAR

arguments.name: SPM
arguments.description: S'

arguments.name: S0
arguments.description: So

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: STARBDRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the radius of an imaginary circle that is the outer bound for vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies reference circles that are superimposed on the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARINRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the inner radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option. For traditional graphics, the radius is specified in horizontal percent screen units. For ODS Graphics output, the radius is specified in pixels.

arguments.name: STARLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for labeling the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Labels all vertices of all stars.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Labels all vertices of the leftmost star.

arguments.name: HIGH
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie outside the outer circle.

arguments.name: LOW
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle.

arguments.name: OUT
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle or outside the outer circle.

arguments.name: STARLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the style of the legend used to identify the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CLOCK
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 12:00)

arguments.name: CLOCK0
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 0:00)

arguments.name: DEGREES
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by angles in degrees, with 0 degrees corresponding to 12 o'clock

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: STARLEGENDLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies the label displayed to the left of the legend for stars requested with the STARLEGEND= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes.

arguments.name: STAROPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the star fill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default star fill opacity is 0.75.

arguments.name: STAROUTRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the outer radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARS=
arguments.description: Specifies colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARSPECS=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to standardize the star vertex variables listed with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARSTART=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertex angle for the first variable in the STARVERTICES= list.

arguments.name: STARTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the style of the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CORONA
arguments.description: Polygon with star-vertices emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: POLYGON
arguments.description: Closed polygon

arguments.name: RADIAL
arguments.description: Rays emanating from the center

arguments.name: SPOKE
arguments.description: Rays emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: WEDGE
arguments.description: Closed polygon with rays from the center to each vertex

arguments.name: STARVERTICES=
arguments.description: Superimposes a star (polygon) at each point on the primary chart.

arguments.name: STDDEVIATIONS
arguments.description: Specifies that the estimate of the process standard deviation, σ, is to be calculated from subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: SUBGROUPN=
arguments.description: Specifies the subgroup sample sizes as a constant value or as the values of a variable in the DATA= data set.

arguments.name: SYMBOLCHARS=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of characters used to mark the points plotted on line printer charts when a symbol-variable is used.

arguments.name: SYMBOLLEGEND=
arguments.description: Controls the legend for the levels of a symbol-variable.

arguments.name: LEGENDn
arguments.description: You can specify SYMBOLLEGEND=LEGENDn, where n is the number of a LEGEND statement defined previously.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the default legend.

arguments.name: SYMBOLORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the order in which symbols are assigned for levels of the symbol-variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Assigns symbols to values in the order in which values appear in the input data set.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Assigns symbols based on sorted order of internal values of the symbol variable

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Assigns them based on sorted formatted values.

arguments.name: TABLEALL
arguments.description: Tabulates the information about the control chart and is equivalent to specifying all of the following options: TABLES, TABLECENTRAL, TABLEID, TABLELEGEND, TABLEOUT, and TABLETESTS. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEBOX
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a subgroup. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a subgroup. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLECENTRAL
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEID
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column for each of the ID variables. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLELEGEND
arguments.description: Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEOUTLIM
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns indicating which control limits (if any) are exceeded. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLES
arguments.description: Creates a basic table of the subgroup values, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup summary statistics, and the upper and lower control limits. Rows of the table correspond to subgroups. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLETESTS
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are positive. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are positive. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TARGET=
arguments.description: Provides target values used to compute the capability index Cpm, which is saved in the OUTLIMITS= data set.

arguments.name: TEST2RESET=
arguments.description: Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a secondary chart. The specified variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests are requested.

arguments.name: TEST2RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 2 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
7 in a row
8 in a row
9 in a row
At least 10 out of 11 in a row
At least 12 out of 14 in a row
At least 16 out of 20 in a row

arguments.name: TEST3RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
Length of the pattern is at least 6.
Length of the pattern is at least 7.
Length of the pattern is at least 8.

arguments.name: TESTACROSS
arguments.description: Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options be applied without regard to phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) determined by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data set.

arguments.name: TESTCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character for the line segments that connect any sequence of points for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive. The default character is the number of the test (with values 1 to 8).

arguments.name: TESTLABBOX
arguments.description: Requests that labels for subgroups with positive tests for special causes are positioned so they do not overlap. The labels are enclosed in boxes that are connected to the associated subgroup points with line segments.

arguments.name: TESTLABEL=
arguments.description: Provides labels for points at which one of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive.

arguments.name: TESTINDEX
arguments.description: Labels points with the single-digit index that requested the test in a TESTS= or TESTS2= list.

arguments.name: SPACE
arguments.description: Request a label of the form Test k.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses labeling.

arguments.name: ‘label'
arguments.description: A label of up to 16 characters enclosed in quotes.

arguments.name: (variable)
arguments.description: A variable (enclosed in parentheses) whose values are used as labels. The variable must be provided in the input data set, and it can be numeric or character.

arguments.name: TESTNMETHOD=
arguments.description: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: STANDARDIZE
arguments.description: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: TESTOVERLAP
arguments.description: Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

arguments.name: TESTRESET=
arguments.description: Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a primary chart. The specified variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests are requested.

arguments.name: TESTS2=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

arguments.name: TESTS=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, and Western Electric rules.

arguments.name: TESTSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol for plotting subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

arguments.name: TESTSYMBOLHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

arguments.name: TOTPANELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the total number of panels to be used to display the chart. This option overrides the NPANEL= option.

arguments.name: TRENDVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of trend variables, one for each process listed in the chart statement.

arguments.name: TURNALL
arguments.description: Turns the labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL= and OUTLABEL2= options so that they are strung out vertically.

arguments.name: TURNHLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the major tick mark labels for the horizontal (group) axis so that they are strung out vertically. By default, labels are arranged horizontally.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the _TYPE_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= data set, which in turn indicates whether certain parameter variables in this data set represent estimates or standard (known) values.

arguments.name: ESTIMATE
arguments.description: _MEAN_=estimate, _STDDEV_=estimate

arguments.name: STDMU
arguments.description: _MEAN_=standard, _STDDEV_=estimate

arguments.name: STDSIGMA
arguments.description: _MEAN_=estimate, _STDDEV_=standard

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: _MEAN_=standard, _STDDEV_=standard

arguments.name: U0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the average number u of nonconformities per unit produced by the process.

arguments.name: UCLLABEL2=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the secondary chart. The label can be up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: UCLLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the primary chart. The label can be up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: USL=
arguments.description: Provides upper specification limits used to compute capability indices.

arguments.name: USYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in a U chart.

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: U

arguments.name: UBAR
arguments.description: UBAR

arguments.name: UPM
arguments.description: U'

arguments.name: U0
arguments.description: Uo

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VAXIS2=
arguments.description: Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a secondary chart. The values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of values displayed in the chart.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a primary chart. The values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of values displayed in the chart.

arguments.name: VFORMAT2=
arguments.description: Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis of a secondary chart.

arguments.name: VFORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis of a primary chart.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, VMINOR=0.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the length in percent screen units of the offset at the ends of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF2=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the secondary chart.

arguments.name: VREF2LABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF2= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the primary chart.

arguments.name: VREFCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options on line printer charts. The default is the hyphen (-).

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABEL= and VREF2LABEL= labels.
Left-justified in subplot area
Right-justified in subplot area
Left-justified in right margin

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a primary chart.

arguments.name: VZERO2
arguments.description: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a secondary chart.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for the axis and frame lines. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WEBOUT=
arguments.description: Produces an output data set containing all the data in an OUTTABLE= data set plus graphics coordinates for points (subgroup summary statistics) that are displayed on a control chart.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for grid lines requested with the ENDGRID and GRID options. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WLIMITS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for the control limits and central line. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WNEEDLES=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of needles connecting plotted points to the central line, as requested with the NEEDLES option.

arguments.name: WOVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on secondary chart overlay plots.

arguments.name: WOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on primary chart overlay plots.

arguments.name: WSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of circles requested by the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: WSTARS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of stars requested by the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: WTESTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect patterns of points for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WTREND=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect points on trend charts requested with the TRENDVAR= option. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: XSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an XBAR chart or a median chart.
