arguments.name: XBAROPM
arguments.description: XBAR0PM

arguments.name: YPCT1=
arguments.description: Specifies a percent (ranging from 0 to 100) that determines the length of the vertical axis for the primary chart in proportion to the sum of the lengths of the vertical axes for the primary and secondary charts.

arguments.name: YSCALE=
arguments.description: Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units. The YSCALE= option is available only in the PCHART statement.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units.

arguments.name: ZEROSTD
arguments.description: Specifies that a control chart is to be constructed and displayed regardless of whether the estimated process standard deviation is zero.

arguments.name: ZEROSTD=
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

arguments.name: NOLIMITS
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

arguments.name: ZONE2LABELS
arguments.description: Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES2 or ZONE2VALUES options.

arguments.name: ZONE2VALUES
arguments.description: Labels R or s chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONE2VALUES option is specified the ZONES2 option is not required.

arguments.name: ZONECHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to form the zone lines requested by the ZONES option.

arguments.name: ZONELABELS
arguments.description: Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES or ZONEVALUES options.

arguments.name: ZONES
arguments.description: Adds lines to a primary chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests requested with the TESTS= option.

arguments.name: ZONES2
arguments.description: Adds lines to an R or s chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for tests requested with the TESTS2= option.

arguments.name: ZONEVALPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the ZONEVALUES= and ZONE2VALUES= labels.
Left-justified in subplot area
Right-justified in subplot area
Left-justified in right margin

arguments.name: ZONEVALUES
arguments.description: Labels the primary chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONEVALUES option is specified the ZONES option is not required.

statements.name: UCHART
statements.description: The UCHART statement creates ANOM charts for group (treatment level) rates, also referred to as ANOM U charts.

arguments.name: ALLLABEL2=
arguments.description: Labels every point on an R, s, or trend chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: ALLLABEL=
arguments.description: Labels every point on the primary chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Plots summary statistics for all subgroups, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data set.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Requests probability limits. If you specify ALPHA=α, the control limits are computed so that the probability is α that a subgroup summary statistic exceeds its control limits.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE2=
arguments.description: Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set that enhances a primary chart.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set.

arguments.name: BILEVEL
arguments.description: Arranges the Shewhart chart in two levels (rather than the default of one level) so that twice as much data can be displayed on a page or screen.

arguments.name: BLOCKLABELPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the position of a block-variable label in the block legend.

arguments.name: ABOVE
arguments.description: Places the label immediately above the legend.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Places the label to the left of the legend.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Places the label to the right of the legend.

arguments.name: BLOCKLABTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies how lengthy block variable values are treated when there is insufficient space to display them in the block legend.

arguments.name: SCALED
arguments.description: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.

arguments.name: TRUNCATED
arguments.description: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: Rotates the values of the block variable displayed closest to the chart by 90 degreest.

arguments.name: ROTATEALL
arguments.description: RotateS the values of all block variables.

arguments.name: BLOCKPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the legend for the values of the block variables.
Top of chart, offset from axis frame
Top of chart, immediately above axis frame
Bottom of chart, immediately above horizontal axis
Bottom of chart, below horizontal axis label

arguments.name: BLOCKREFOPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the wall fill opacity for blocks and phases when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default wall fill opacity is 0.15.

arguments.name: BLOCKREP
arguments.description: Specifies that block variable values for all groups be displayed. By default, only the first block variable value in any block is displayed, and repeated block variable values are not displayed.

arguments.name: BLOCKVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are used to assign colors for filling the background of the legend associated with block variables.

arguments.name: BOXCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies that the points representing subgroup means, medians, maximum values, minimum values, first quartiles or third quartiles in box-and-whisker plots created with the BOXCHART statement are to be connected.
arguments.help: BOXCONNECT=MEAN | MEDIAN | MAX | MIN | Q1 | Q3

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group means be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group medians be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group maximum values be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group minimum values be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: Q1
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group first quartiles be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: Q3
arguments.description: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group third quartiles be connected with line segments.

arguments.name: BOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are used to assign colors for the outlines of box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: BOXFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies how box-and-whisker plots are filled with colors from the ODS style.

arguments.name: <variable>
arguments.description: You can specify a variable whose values are used to group box-and-whiskers plots for assigning fill colors from the ODS style.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Produces unfilled boxes.

arguments.name: EMPTY
arguments.description: Produces unfilled boxes.

arguments.name: BOXOPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the box fill opacity for box-and-whisker charts when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default box fill opacity is 0.75.

arguments.name: BOXSTYLE=
arguments.description: [Specifies the style of the box-and-whiskers plots displayed.
arguments.help: BOXSTYLE=SKELETAL | SCHEMATIC | SCHEMATICID | SCHEMATICIDFAR | POINTS | POINTSJOIN | POINTSBOX | POINTSID | POINTSJOINID | POINTSSCHEMATIC

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: The whiskers are drawn from the edges of the box to the extreme values of the group.

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: A whisker is drawn from the upper edge of the box to the largest observed value within the upper fence, and another is drawn from the lower edge of the box to the smallest observed value within the lower fence.

arguments.name: SCHEMATICID
arguments.description: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which an ID variable value is used to label the symbol marking each observation outside the upper and lower fences.

arguments.name: SCHEMATICIDFAR
arguments.description: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which the value of the ID variable is used to label the symbol marking each observation outside the lower and upper far fences

arguments.name: POINTS
arguments.description: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points, and neither a box nor whiskers are drawn.

arguments.name: POINTSJOIN
arguments.description: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points joined with a vertical line. Neither a box nor whiskers are drawn.

arguments.name: POINTSBOX
arguments.description: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points enclosed in a box.

arguments.name: POINTSID
arguments.description: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted using labels specified as the values of the first variable in the ID statement.

arguments.name: POINTSJOINID
arguments.description: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted using labels specified as the values of the first variable in the ID statement, and the values are joined by a vertical line.

arguments.name: POINTSSCHEMATIC
arguments.description: A schematic box chart is overlaid with points plotting all observations in the subgroups.

arguments.name: BOXWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the width (in horizontal percent screen units) of the box-and-whiskers plots.

arguments.name: BOXWIDTHSCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies that the width of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement is to vary proportionately to a particular function of the group size n.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement.

arguments.name: CBLOCKLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies fill colors for the frames that enclose the block variable labels in a block legend.

arguments.name: CBLOCKVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are colors for filling the background of the legend associated with block variables.

arguments.name: CBOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement.

arguments.name: CBOXFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the interior fill colors for the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement.

arguments.name: CCLIP=
arguments.description: Specifies a color for the plotting symbol that is specified with the CLIPSYMBOL= option to mark clipped values.

arguments.name: CCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for line segments connecting points on the chart.

arguments.name: CCOVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors for line segments connecting points on secondary chart overlays.

arguments.name: CCOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors for line segments connecting points on primary chart overlays.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling the rectangle enclosed by the axes and the frame. By default, this area is not filled. The CFRAME= option cannot be used in conjunction with the NOFRAME option.

arguments.name: CFRAMELAB=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling rectangles that frame the point labels displayed with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, and OUTLABEL2= options.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the grid requested by the ENDGRID or GRID option. By default, the grid is the same color as the axes.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the lines requested by the HREF= and HREF2= options.

arguments.name: CIINDICES
arguments.description: Requests capability index confidence limits based on subgroup summary data, calculated using "effective degrees of freedom". TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit. Valid values are LOWER, UPPER and TWOSIDED. The default value is TWOSIDED.

arguments.name: CINFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area inside the upper and lower control limits.

arguments.name: <color>
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area inside the upper and lower control limits.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Leaves the area between the contol limits unfilled.

arguments.name: EMPTY
arguments.description: Leaves the area between the contol limits unfilled.

arguments.name: CLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, and OUTLABEL2= options.

arguments.name: CLIMITS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the control limits, the central line, and the labels for these lines.

arguments.name: CLIPCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a plot character that identifies clipped points, as requested with the CLIPFACTOR= option.

arguments.name: CLIPFACTOR=
arguments.description: Requests clipping of extreme values on the control chart. The factor that you specify determines the extent to which these values are clipped, and it must be greater than 1.

arguments.name: CLIPLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the label for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CLIPLEGPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the position for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: Positions the legend at the top of the chart.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: positions the legend at the bottom of the chart.

arguments.name: CLIPSUBCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a substitution character (such as '#') for the label provided with the CLIPLEGEND= option.

arguments.name: CLIPSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a plot symbol used to identify clipped points on the chart and in the legend when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CLIPSYMBOLHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the symbol marker used to identify clipped points on the chart when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CNEEDLES=
arguments.description: Requests that points are to be connected to the central line with vertical line segments (needles) and specifies the color of the needles.

arguments.name: CONNECTCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to form line segments that connect points on a chart. The default character is a plus (+) sign.

arguments.name: CONTROLSTAT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means or for subgroup medians.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup medians.

arguments.name: COUT
arguments.description: Specify COUT with no argument to use an appropriate contrasting color from the ODS style.

arguments.name: COUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the plotting symbols and the portions of connecting line segments that lie outside the control limits.

arguments.name: COVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors used to plot secondary chart overlay variables. Colors in the COVERLAY2= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY2= list.

arguments.name: COVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors used to plot primary chart overlay variables. Colors in the COVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: COVERLAYCLIP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: CPHASEBOX=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a box that encloses all of the plotted points for a phase (group of consecutive observations that have the same value of the variable _PHASE_).

arguments.name: CPHASEBOXCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for line segments that connect the vertical edges of adjacent enclosing boxes requested with the CPHASEBOX= option or the CPHASEBOXFILL= option.

arguments.name: CPHASEBOXFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the fill color for a box that encloses all of the plotted points for a phase.

arguments.name: CPHASELEG=
arguments.description: Specifies a text color for the phase labels requested with the PHASELEGEND option.

arguments.name: CPHASEMEANCONNECT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for line segments that connect points representing the average of the values plotted within a phase.

arguments.name: CSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies a color for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: CSTARFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies a color or colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CSTAROUT
arguments.description: Specifies to use an appropriate contrasting color from the ODS style for those portions of the outlines of stars (requested with the STARVERTICES= option) that exceed the inner or outer circles.

arguments.name: CSTAROUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a color for those portions of the outlines of stars (requested with the STARVERTICES= option) that exceed the inner or outer circles.

arguments.name: CSTARS=
arguments.description: Specifies a color or colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in a C chart.

arguments.name: C
arguments.description: C

arguments.name: CBAR
arguments.description: CBAR

arguments.name: CPM
arguments.description: C'

arguments.name: C0
arguments.description: Co

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: You can specify a quoted label of length 16 or less.

arguments.name: CTESTLABBOX=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for boxes enclosing labels for positive tests for special causes requested with the TESTLABBOX option.

arguments.name: CTESTS=
arguments.description: Specifies colors for labels indicating points where a test is positive.

arguments.name: CTESTSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default color is the color specified in the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options.

arguments.name: CZONES=
arguments.description: Requests lines marking zones A, B, and C for the tests for special causes (see the TESTS= option) and specifies the color for these lines.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION2=
arguments.description: Specifies a description for the secondary chart of length 256 or less that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default string is the variable name. The DESCRIPTION2= option is available in the IRCHART, MRCHART, XRCHART, and XSCHART statements, and it is used in conjunction with the SEPARATE option. A related option is NAME2=.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description for the primary chart of length 256 or less that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default string is the variable name. A related option is NAME=.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: Specifies that numeric subgroup variable values be treated as discrete values, so that each tick value on the default subgroup axis corresponds to a unique subgroup variable value.

arguments.name: ENDGRID
arguments.description: Adds a grid to the rightmost portion of the chart, beginning with the first labeled major tick mark position that follows the last plotted point.

arguments.name: EXCHART
arguments.description: Creates a control chart only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for labels and legends.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines specified with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of box-and-whiskers plots. By default, reference lines are drawn behind the box-and-whiskers plots and can be obscured by filled boxes.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: Adds a grid to the control chart. Grid lines are horizontal lines positioned at labeled major tick marks, and they cover the length and height of the plotting area.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal (subgroup) axis. If the group variable is numeric, the values must be numeric and equally spaced. If the group variable is character, values must be quoted strings of up to 16 characters. Optionally, you can specify an axis name defined in a previous AXIS statement.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height (in vertical screen percent units) of the text for axis labels and legends. This value takes precedence over the HTEXT= value specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the length (in percent screen units) of the offset at both ends of the horizontal axis. You can eliminate the offset by specifying HOFFSET=0.

arguments.name: HREF2=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the secondary chart.

arguments.name: HREF2DATA=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the secondary chart. The HREF2DATA= option must be used in place of the HREF2= option to specify a data set using the quoted filename notation.

arguments.name: HREF2LABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the HREF2= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the primary chart.

arguments.name: HREFCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the HREF= and HREF2= options on line printer charts. The default is the vertical bar (|).

arguments.name: HREFDATA=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the primary chart. The HREFDATA= option must be used in place of the HREF= option to specify a data set using the quoted filename notation.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABEL= label.
Along top of subplot area
Staggered from top to bottom of subplot area
Along bottom of subplot area
Staggered from bottom to top of subplot area

arguments.name: HTML2=
arguments.description: Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with points on a secondary chart when traditional graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with points on a primary control chart when traditional graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with symbols in the legend for the levels of a symbol-variable.

arguments.name: IDCOLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic box-and-whiskers plots (that is, when you specify the keyword SCHEMATIC, SCHEMATICID, or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option).

arguments.name: IDCTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: IDSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic box-and-whisker plots produced with the BOXCHART statement when you use one of the following options: BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATIC, BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATICID, and BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATICIDFAR. The default symbol is SQUARE.

arguments.name: INDEPENDENTZONES
arguments.description: Specifies that the widths of the zones requested with the ZONES option be computed independently above and below the center line of the chart, so that the width of each zone is one-third of the difference between the process mean and the control limit on its side of the chart.

arguments.name: INFILLOPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the control limit infill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default control limit infill opacity is 0.25.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the natural time interval between consecutive group positions when a time, date, or datetime format is associated with a numeric group variable.
arguments.help: INTERVAL=DAY | DTDAY | HOUR | MINUTE | MONTH | QTR | SECOND

arguments.name: DAY
arguments.description: For DATE, WEEKDATE, WORDDATE, YYMMDD, or MMDDYY format

arguments.name: DTDAY
arguments.description: For DATETIME format

arguments.name: HOUR
arguments.description: For HHMM or HOUR format

arguments.name: MINUTE
arguments.description: For MMSS format

arguments.name: MONTH
arguments.description: For MONYY format

arguments.name: QTR
arguments.description: For YYQ format

arguments.name: SECOND
arguments.description: For TIME or TOD format

arguments.name: INTSTART=
arguments.description: Specifies the starting value for a numeric horizontal axis when a date, time, or datetime format is associated with the group variable.

arguments.name: LABELANGLE=
arguments.description: Specifies the angle at which labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, and OUTLABEL2= options are drawn. A positive angle rotates the labels counterclockwise; a negative angle rotates them clockwise. By default, labels are oriented horizontally.

arguments.name: LABELFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and TESTLABELn= options.

arguments.name: LABELHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height (in vertical percent screen units) for labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and TESTLABEL= options.

arguments.name: LBOXES=
arguments.description: Specifies the line types for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement.

arguments.name: LCLLABEL2=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the lower control limit in the secondary chart. The label can be of length 16 or less. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: LCLLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the lower control limit in the primary chart. The label can be of length 16 or less. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: LENDGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the ENDGRID option. The default value is 1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the GRID option. The default value is 1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for reference lines requested with the HREF= and HREF2 options. The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LIMITN=
arguments.description: Specifies either a varying or a fixed nominal sample size n for the control limits.

arguments.name: VARYING
arguments.description: Specifies a varying nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: Specifies a fixed nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: LIMLABSUBCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a substitution character (such as #) for labels provided as quoted strings with the LCLLABEL=, LCLLABEL2=, UCLLABEL=, UCLLABEL2=, CSYMBOL=, NPSYMBOL=, PSYMBOL=, RSYMBOL=, SSYMBOL=, USYMBOL=, and XSYMBOL= options.

arguments.name: LLIMITS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for control limits. The default is 4, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on secondary chart overlays. Line types in the LOVERLAY2= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY2= list.

arguments.name: LOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on primary chart overlays. Line types in the LOVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

arguments.name: LSL=
arguments.description: Provides lower specification limits used to compute capability indices.

arguments.name: LSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies one or more line types for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: LSTARS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line types for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: LTESTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the line segments that connect patterns of points for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) is positive. The default is 1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LTMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the left marginal area for the plot requested with the LTMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: LTMPLOT=
arguments.description: Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the left margin of the control chart.
arguments.help: LTMPLOT=HISTOGRAM | DIGIDOT | SKELETAL | SCHEMATIC | SCHEMATICID | SCHEMATICIDFAR

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Histogram

arguments.name: DIGIDOT
arguments.description: Digidot plot

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: Skeletal box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATICID
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled

arguments.name: SCHEMATICIDFAR
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options. The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LZONES=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests requested with the TESTS= and/or TESTS2= options. The default is n=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXPANELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of pages or screens for a chart. By default, n=20.

arguments.name: MEDCENTRAL=
arguments.description: Identifies a method for estimating the process mean, µ, which is represented by the central line on a median chart.

arguments.name: AVGMEAN
arguments.description: Average of subgroup means

arguments.name: AVGMED
arguments.description: Average of subgroup medians

arguments.name: MEDMED
arguments.description: Median of subgroup medians

arguments.name: MISSBREAK
arguments.description: Determines how subgroups are formed when observations are read from a DATA= data set and a character subgroup-variable is provided.

arguments.name: MRRESTART
arguments.description: Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted when any missing value is encountered.

arguments.name: MRRESTART=
arguments.description: ' Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted only when the specified missing value is encountered.

arguments.name: MU0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the process mean µ.

arguments.name: NAME2=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the secondary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the primary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

arguments.name: NDECIMAL2=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits and the central line in a secondary chart.

arguments.name: NDECIMAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits and the central line in the primary chart.

arguments.name: NEEDLES
arguments.description: Connects plotted points to the central line with vertical line segments (needles).

arguments.name: NMARKERS
arguments.description: Identifies a plotted subgroup summary statistic with a special symbol marker (character) when the corresponding subgroup sample size is not equal to the nominal control limit sample size n.

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.name: NOBLOCKREFFILL
arguments.description: Suppresses the block and phase wall fills from ODS Graphics output. By default, block and phase walls are filled when ODS Graphics is in effect.

arguments.name: NOBLOCKREF
arguments.description: Suppresses block and phase reference lines from ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: NOBOXFILLLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for the levels of a BOXFILL= or STARFILL= variable in ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: NOBYREF
arguments.description: Specifies that the reference line information in an HREF=, HREF2=, VREF=, or VREF2= data set be applied uniformly to box plots created for all the BY groups in the input data set. If you specify the NOBYREF option, you do not need to provide BY variables in the reference line data set. By default, you must provide BY variables.

arguments.name: NOCHART2
arguments.description: Suppresses the creation of a secondary chart. You typically use this option in the IRCHART statement to create a chart for individual measurements and suppress the accompanying chart for moving ranges.

arguments.name: NOCHART
arguments.description: Suppresses the creation of the chart. You typically specify the NOCHART option when you are using the procedure to compute control limits and save them in an output data set.

arguments.name: NOCONNECT
arguments.description: Suppresses line segments that connect points on the chart.

arguments.name: NOCTL
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the central line in a primary chart.

arguments.name: NOCTL2
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the central line in a secondary chart.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the default frame drawn around the chart.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal (subgroup) axis.

arguments.name: NOLCL
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a primary chart.

arguments.name: NOLCL2
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a secondary chart.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the default legend for subgroup sample sizes, which appears by default below the chart.

arguments.name: NOLIMIT0
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of a fixed lower control limit if and only if the value of the limit is zero.

arguments.name: NOLIMIT1
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of a fixed upper control limit on a p chart if and only if the value of the control limit is 1 (or 100%), or on an np chart if and only if the value of the control limit is n.

arguments.name: NOLIMITLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the default labels for the control limits and central lines.

arguments.name: NOLIMITS
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of control limits.

arguments.name: NOLIMITSFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the default frame for the control limit information that is displayed across the top of the chart when multiple sets of control limits with distinct multiples of σ and nominal control limit sample sizes are read from a LIMITS= data set.

arguments.name: NOLIMITSLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for the control limits, which appears by default in the upper right corner of the chart.

arguments.name: NOOVERLAYLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for overlay variables which is displayed by default when the OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option is specified.

arguments.name: NOPHASEFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the default frame for the legend requested by the PHASELEGEND option.

arguments.name: NOREADLIMITS
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits for each process listed in the chart statement are not to be read from the LIMITS= data set specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement.

arguments.name: NOTCHES
arguments.description: Specifies that box-and-whiskers plots created by the BOXCHART statement are to be notched.

arguments.name: NOTESTACROSS
arguments.description: Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options not be applied across the boundaries of phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) determined by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data set.

arguments.name: NOTICKREP
arguments.description: Applies to character-valued subgroup-variables and specifies that only the first occurrence of repeated, adjacent group values be labeled on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: NOTRANSPARENCY
arguments.description: Disables transparency in ODS Graphics output, so that all graph features are opaque.

arguments.name: NOTRENDCONNECT
arguments.description: Suppresses line segments that connect points on a trend chart.

arguments.name: NOTRUNC
arguments.description: Overrides the vertical axis truncation at zero.

arguments.name: NOUCL
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a primary chart.

arguments.name: NOUCL2
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a secondary chart.

arguments.name: NOVANGLE
arguments.description: Requests that the vertical axis label be strung out vertically.

arguments.name: NPANELPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of subgroup positions per panel on each chart.

arguments.name: NPSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an np chart.
arguments.help: NPSYMBOL='*label*' | NP | NPBAR | NPPM | NPPM2 | NP0

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: A quoted label up to 16 characters in length.

arguments.name: NP
arguments.description: NP

arguments.name: NPBAR
arguments.description: NPBAR

arguments.name: NPPM
arguments.description: NP'

arguments.name: NPPM2
arguments.description: NP''

arguments.name: NP0
arguments.description: NP0

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE2=
arguments.description: Adds a secondary footnote to ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE2
arguments.description: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement is used as the graph footnote.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: A quoted string is used as the secondary footnote.

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE=
arguments.description: Adds a footnote to ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE1
arguments.description: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: A quoted string is used as the graph footnote.

arguments.name: ODSLEGENDEXPAND
arguments.description: Specifies that legend entries contain all levels observed in the data.

arguments.name: ODSTITLE2=
arguments.description: Specifies a secondary title for ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: TITLE2
arguments.description: Uses the value of SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary graph title.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: A quoted string is used as the secondary title.

arguments.name: ODSTITLE=
arguments.description: Specifies a title for ODS Graphics output.

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.

arguments.name: TITLE1
arguments.description: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all titles from the graph.

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: Uses the default ODS Graphics title (a descriptive title consisting of the plot type and the process variable name.)

arguments.name: LABELFMT
arguments.description: Uses the default ODS Graphics title with the variable label instead of the variable name.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: A quoted string is used as the graph title.

arguments.name: OUTBOX=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set that contains subgroup summary statistics, control limits, and outlier values for a box chart.

arguments.name: OUTFILL
arguments.description: Fills the areas outside the control limits that lie between the connected points and the control limits and are bounded by connecting lines.

arguments.name: OUTFILLOPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the control limit outfill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default control limit outfill opacity is 0.25.

arguments.name: OUTHIGHHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points above the upper fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: OUTHISTORY=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set that contains the subgroup summary statistics.

arguments.name: OUTINDEX=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the _INDEX_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= output data set.

arguments.name: OUTLABEL2=
arguments.description: Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on an R or s chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: OUTLABEL=
arguments.description: Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on the primary chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

arguments.name: OUTLIMITS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set that saves the control limits.

arguments.name: OUTLOWHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points below the lower fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed into HTML.

arguments.name: OUTPHASE=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the _PHASE_ variable in the OUTHISTORY= data set.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: Creates an output SAS data set that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

arguments.name: OVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies variables to be overlaid on a secondary control chart.

arguments.name: OVERLAY2HTML=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on secondary chart overlays.

arguments.name: OVERLAY2ID=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on secondary chart overlays.

arguments.name: OVERLAY2SYM=
arguments.description: Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on a secondary control chart.

arguments.name: OVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies variables to be overlaid on the primary control chart.

arguments.name: OVERLAYCLIPSYM=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: OVERLAYCLIPSYMHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height for the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

arguments.name: OVERLAYHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on primary chart overlays.

arguments.name: OVERLAYID=
arguments.description: Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on primary chart overlays.

arguments.name: OVERLAYLEGLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies the label displayed to the left of the overlay legend produced by the OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes. The default label is "Overlays:".

arguments.name: OVERLAYSYM=
arguments.description: Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

arguments.name: OVERLAYSYMHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the heights of symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

arguments.name: P0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value po for the proportion of nonconforming items produced by the process.

arguments.name: PAGENUM=
arguments.description: Specifies the form of the label used for pagination. The string can be up to 16 characters, and it must include one or two occurrences of the substitution character '#'. The first '#' is replaced with the page number, and the optional second '#' is replaced with the total number of pages.

arguments.name: PAGENUMPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies where to position the page number requested with the PAGENUM= option.
arguments.help: PAGENUMPOS=TL | TR | BL | BR | TL100 | TR100 | BL0 | BR0

arguments.name: TL
arguments.description: Top left

arguments.name: TR
arguments.description: Top right

arguments.name: BL
arguments.description: Bottom left

arguments.name: BR
arguments.description: Bottom right

arguments.name: TL100
arguments.description: Top left. TL100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when a title is displayed.

arguments.name: TR100
arguments.description: Top right. TR100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when a title is displayed.

arguments.name: BL0
arguments.description: Bottom left. BL0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page when footnotes are displayed.

arguments.name: BR0
arguments.description: Bottom right. BR0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page when footnotes are displayed.

arguments.name: PCTLDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction of box-and-whiskers plots requested with the BOXCHART statement.
Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 3 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 4 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

arguments.name: PHASEBOXLABELS
arguments.description: Draws phase labels as titles along the top of phase boxes.

arguments.name: PHASEBREAK
arguments.description: Specifies that the last point in a phase (defined as a block of consecutive subgroups with the same value of the _PHASE_ variable) is not to be connected to the first point in the next phase.

arguments.name: PHASELABTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies how lengthy _PHASE_ variable values are to be displayed when there is insufficient space in the legend requested with the PHASELEGEND option.

arguments.name: SCALED
arguments.description: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.

arguments.name: TRUNCATED
arguments.description: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.

arguments.name: PHASELEGEND
arguments.description: Identifies the phases requested with the READPHASES= option in a legend across the top of the chart.

arguments.name: PHASELIMITS
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits and center line are to be labeled for each phase specified with the READPHASES= option, providing the limits are constant within that phase.

arguments.name: PHASEMEANSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a symbol marker for the average of the values plotted within a phase.

arguments.name: PHASEPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the phase legend.
Top of chart, offset from axis frame
Top of chart, immediately above axis frame
Bottom of chart, immediately above horizontal axis
Bottom of chart, below horizontal axis label

arguments.name: PHASEREF
arguments.description: Delineates the phases specified with the READPHASES= option with reference lines drawn vertically.

arguments.name: PHASEREFLEVEL=
arguments.description: Enables you to associate phase reference lines (block reference lines) with either the innermost or the outermost level.

arguments.name: INNER
arguments.description: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost level.

arguments.name: OUTER
arguments.description: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the outermost level.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No association of phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost or outermost level.

arguments.name: PHASEVALSEP
arguments.description: Displays vertical lines separating phase values in the phase legend.

arguments.name: PHASEVARLABEL
arguments.description: Displays the label associated with the variable _PHASE_ above the phase values in the phase legend.

arguments.name: POINTSHTML=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with points on a box chart when the BOXSTYLE= value is POINTS, POINTSJOIN, POINTSBOX, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID.

arguments.name: PSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in a P chart.

arguments.name: P
arguments.description: P

arguments.name: PBAR
arguments.description: PBAR

arguments.name: PPM
arguments.description: P'

arguments.name: P0
arguments.description: Po

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: RANGES
arguments.description: Estimates the process standard deviation for a boxplot using subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: READALPHA
arguments.description: Specifies that the variable _ALPHA_, rather than the variable _SIGMAS_, is to be read from a LIMITS= data set when both variables are available in the data set.

arguments.name: READINDEX=
arguments.description: Reads one or more sets of control limits from a LIMITS= data set (specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement) for each process listed in the chart statement.

arguments.name: READLIMITS
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits are to be read from a LIMITS= data set specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement.

arguments.name: READPHASES=
arguments.description: Selects blocks of consecutive observations to be read from the input data set.

arguments.name: REPEAT
arguments.description: Specifies that the horizontal axis of a chart that spans multiple panels be arranged so that the last subgroup position on a panel is repeated as the first subgroup position on the next panel.

arguments.name: RSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an R chart.

arguments.name: R
arguments.description: R

arguments.name: RBAR
arguments.description: RBAR

arguments.name: RPM
arguments.description: R'

arguments.name: R0
arguments.description: Ro

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: RTMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the right marginal area for the plot requested with the RTMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: RTMPLOT=
arguments.description: Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the right margin of the control chart.
arguments.help: RTMPLOT=DIGIDOT | HISTOGRAM | SKELETAL | SCHEMATIC | SCHEMATICID | SCHEMATICIDFAR

arguments.name: DIGIDOT
arguments.description: Digidot plot

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Histogram

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: Skeletal box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot

arguments.name: SCHEMATICID
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled

arguments.name: SCHEMATICIDFAR
arguments.description: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

arguments.name: SEPARATE
arguments.description: Displays primary and secondary charts on separate screens or pages.

arguments.name: SERIFS
arguments.description: Adds serifs to the whiskers of skeletal box-and-whisker charts.

arguments.name: SIGMA0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value, σ0, for the process standard deviation, σ.

arguments.name: SIGMAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.name: SIMULATEQCFONT
arguments.description: Draws the central line labels using a simulated software font rather than a hardware font.

arguments.name: SKIPHLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number n of consecutive tick mark labels, beginning with the second tick mark label, that are thinned (not displayed) on the horizontal (subgroup) axis.

arguments.name: SMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.
arguments.help: SMETHOD=NOWEIGHT | MVLUE | RMSDF | MAD | MMR | MVGRANGE

arguments.name: NOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ.

arguments.name: MVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ

arguments.name: RMSDF
arguments.description: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ

arguments.name: MAD
arguments.description: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ (IRCHART only)

arguments.name: MMR
arguments.description: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ (IRCHART only)

arguments.name: MVGRANGE
arguments.description: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means (XRCHART and XSCHART only)

arguments.name: SPLIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a special character that is inserted into the label of a process variable or summary statistic variable and whose purpose is to split the label into two parts.

arguments.name: SSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an S chart.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: S

arguments.name: SBAR
arguments.description: SBAR

arguments.name: SPM
arguments.description: S'

arguments.name: S0
arguments.description: So

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: STARBDRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the radius of an imaginary circle that is the outer bound for vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies reference circles that are superimposed on the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARINRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the inner radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option. For traditional graphics, the radius is specified in horizontal percent screen units. For ODS Graphics output, the radius is specified in pixels.

arguments.name: STARLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for labeling the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Labels all vertices of all stars.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Labels all vertices of the leftmost star.

arguments.name: HIGH
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie outside the outer circle.

arguments.name: LOW
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle.

arguments.name: OUT
arguments.description: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle or outside the outer circle.

arguments.name: STARLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the style of the legend used to identify the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CLOCK
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 12:00)

arguments.name: CLOCK0
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 0:00)

arguments.name: DEGREES
arguments.description: Identifies the vertex variables by angles in degrees, with 0 degrees corresponding to 12 o'clock

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: STARLEGENDLAB=
arguments.description: Specifies the label displayed to the left of the legend for stars requested with the STARLEGEND= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes.

arguments.name: STAROPACITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the star fill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default star fill opacity is 0.75.

arguments.name: STAROUTRADIUS=
arguments.description: Specifies the outer radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARS=
arguments.description: Specifies colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARSPECS=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to standardize the star vertex variables listed with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: STARSTART=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertex angle for the first variable in the STARVERTICES= list.

arguments.name: STARTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the style of the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: CORONA
arguments.description: Polygon with star-vertices emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: POLYGON
arguments.description: Closed polygon

arguments.name: RADIAL
arguments.description: Rays emanating from the center

arguments.name: SPOKE
arguments.description: Rays emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: WEDGE
arguments.description: Closed polygon with rays from the center to each vertex

arguments.name: STARVERTICES=
arguments.description: Superimposes a star (polygon) at each point on the primary chart.

arguments.name: STDDEVIATIONS
arguments.description: Specifies that the estimate of the process standard deviation, σ, is to be calculated from subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: SUBGROUPN=
arguments.description: Specifies the subgroup sample sizes as a constant value or as the values of a variable in the DATA= data set.

arguments.name: SYMBOLCHARS=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of characters used to mark the points plotted on line printer charts when a symbol-variable is used.

arguments.name: SYMBOLLEGEND=
arguments.description: Controls the legend for the levels of a symbol-variable.

arguments.name: LEGENDn
arguments.description: You can specify SYMBOLLEGEND=LEGENDn, where n is the number of a LEGEND statement defined previously.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the default legend.

arguments.name: SYMBOLORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the order in which symbols are assigned for levels of the symbol-variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Assigns symbols to values in the order in which values appear in the input data set.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Assigns symbols based on sorted order of internal values of the symbol variable

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Assigns them based on sorted formatted values.

arguments.name: TABLEALL
arguments.description: Tabulates the information about the control chart and is equivalent to specifying all of the following options: TABLES, TABLECENTRAL, TABLEID, TABLELEGEND, TABLEOUT, and TABLETESTS. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEBOX
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a subgroup. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLECENTRAL
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEID
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column for each of the ID variables. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLELEGEND
arguments.description: Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLEOUTLIM
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns indicating which control limits (if any) are exceeded. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLES
arguments.description: Creates a basic table of the subgroup values, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup summary statistics, and the upper and lower control limits. Rows of the table correspond to subgroups. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TABLETESTS
arguments.description: Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are positive. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: (EXCEPTIONS)
arguments.description: Restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

arguments.name: TARGET=
arguments.description: Provides target values used to compute the capability index Cpm, which is saved in the OUTLIMITS= data set.

arguments.name: TEST2RESET=
arguments.description: Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a secondary chart. The specified variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests are requested.

arguments.name: TEST2RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 2 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
7 in a row
8 in a row
9 in a row
At least 10 out of 11 in a row
At least 12 out of 14 in a row
At least 16 out of 20 in a row

arguments.name: TEST3RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
Length of the pattern is at least 6.
Length of the pattern is at least 7.
Length of the pattern is at least 8.

arguments.name: TESTACROSS
arguments.description: Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options be applied without regard to phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) determined by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data set.

arguments.name: TESTCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character for the line segments that connect any sequence of points for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive. The default character is the number of the test (with values 1 to 8).

arguments.name: TESTLABBOX
arguments.description: Requests that labels for subgroups with positive tests for special causes are positioned so they do not overlap. The labels are enclosed in boxes that are connected to the associated subgroup points with line segments.

arguments.name: TESTLABEL=
arguments.description: Provides labels for points at which one of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive.

arguments.name: TESTINDEX
arguments.description: Labels points with the single-digit index that requested the test in a TESTS= or TESTS2= list.

arguments.name: SPACE
arguments.description: Request a label of the form Test k.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses labeling.

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: A label of up to 16 characters enclosed in quotes.

arguments.name: (variable)
arguments.description: A variable (enclosed in parentheses) whose values are used as labels. The variable must be provided in the input data set, and it can be numeric or character.

arguments.name: TESTNMETHOD=
arguments.description: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: STANDARDIZE
arguments.description: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: TESTOVERLAP
arguments.description: Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

arguments.name: TESTRESET=
arguments.description: Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a primary chart. The specified variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests are requested.

arguments.name: TESTS2=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

arguments.name: TESTS=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, and Western Electric rules.

arguments.name: TESTSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the symbol for plotting subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

arguments.name: TESTSYMBOLHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

arguments.name: TOTPANELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the total number of panels to be used to display the chart. This option overrides the NPANEL= option.

arguments.name: TRENDVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of trend variables, one for each process listed in the chart statement.

arguments.name: TURNALL
arguments.description: Turns the labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL= and OUTLABEL2= options so that they are strung out vertically.

arguments.name: TURNHLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the major tick mark labels for the horizontal (group) axis so that they are strung out vertically. By default, labels are arranged horizontally.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the _TYPE_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= data set, which in turn indicates whether certain parameter variables in this data set represent estimates or standard (known) values.

arguments.name: ESTIMATE
arguments.description: _MEAN_=estimate, _STDDEV_=estimate

arguments.name: STDMU
arguments.description: _MEAN_=standard, _STDDEV_=estimate

arguments.name: STDSIGMA
arguments.description: _MEAN_=estimate, _STDDEV_=standard

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: _MEAN_=standard, _STDDEV_=standard

arguments.name: U0=
arguments.description: Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the average number u of nonconformities per unit produced by the process.

arguments.name: UCLLABEL2=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the secondary chart. The label can be up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: UCLLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the primary chart. The label can be up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

arguments.name: USL=
arguments.description: Provides upper specification limits used to compute capability indices.

arguments.name: USYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in a U chart.

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: U

arguments.name: UBAR
arguments.description: UBAR

arguments.name: UPM
arguments.description: U'

arguments.name: U0
arguments.description: Uo

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VAXIS2=
arguments.description: Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a secondary chart. The values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of values displayed in the chart.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a primary chart. The values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of values displayed in the chart.

arguments.name: VFORMAT2=
arguments.description: Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis of a secondary chart.

arguments.name: VFORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis of a primary chart.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, VMINOR=0.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the length in percent screen units of the offset at the ends of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF2=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the secondary chart.

arguments.name: VREF2LABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF2= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the primary chart.

arguments.name: VREFCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options on line printer charts. The default is the hyphen (-).

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABEL= and VREF2LABEL= labels.
Left-justified in subplot area
Right-justified in subplot area
Left-justified in right margin

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a primary chart.

arguments.name: VZERO2
arguments.description: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a secondary chart.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for the axis and frame lines. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WEBOUT=
arguments.description: Produces an output data set containing all the data in an OUTTABLE= data set plus graphics coordinates for points (subgroup summary statistics) that are displayed on a control chart.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for grid lines requested with the ENDGRID and GRID options. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WLIMITS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels for the control limits and central line. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WNEEDLES=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of needles connecting plotted points to the central line, as requested with the NEEDLES option.

arguments.name: WOVERLAY2=
arguments.description: Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on secondary chart overlay plots.

arguments.name: WOVERLAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on primary chart overlay plots.

arguments.name: WSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of circles requested by the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: WSTARS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of stars requested by the STARVERTICES= option.

arguments.name: WTESTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect patterns of points for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WTREND=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect points on trend charts requested with the TRENDVAR= option. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: XSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the central line in an XBAR chart or a median chart.
arguments.help: XSYMBOL='*label*' | MBAR | MTIL | MU | MU0 | XBAR | XBAR2 | XBARPM | XBAR0 | XBAROPM

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: a quoted label up to 16 characters
